text.text: How can I restrict user access to specific child companies in a Multi-company Management environment?

text: You can restrict user access to specific child companies in a Multi-company Management environment by using the "Billing Customer assignments" setting in Admin > Billing > User Accounts and Admin > Billing > User Groups.

text.text: Where can I find the "Billing Customer Assignments" setting in the ZOLL Billing Admin interface?

text: The "Billing Customer assignments" setting is located in Admin > Billing > User Accounts and Admin > Billing > User Groups.

text.text: What actions can a Company Administrator perform regarding billing customer assignments?

text: Company Administrators can manage payers and facilities at the parent level. They can also create, edit, delete, and copy payers and facilities.

text.text: What happens if a user is not assigned any billing role in User Groups?

text: If a user is not assigned any billing role in User Groups, they can pick and choose any child company from the "Billing Customer assignments" list in their User Account.

text.text: Can users with different roles have different access to child companies?

text: Yes, users with different roles can have different access to child companies. For example, if a child company is selected for a role in User Groups, when that role is assigned to a user in User Accounts, that user automatically gets access to the child companies defined by that role.

text.text: How are billing customer assignments applied if a user is assigned a role in User Groups?

text: If a user is assigned a role in User Groups, the settings in the User Group are applied to the User Account. For example, if a child company is selected for a role in User Groups, when that role is assigned to a user in User Accounts, that user automatically gets access to the child companies defined by that role.

text.text: Can a user override the billing customer assignments configured in User Groups?

text: No, a user cannot override the billing customer assignments configured in User Groups.

text.text: What permissions do Company Administrators have regarding child companies?

text: Company Administrators have full access to everything within ZOLL Billing. They can manage payers and facilities (create/edit/delete/copy) at the parent company level. They can also uncheck a child company in the "Billing Customer assignments" list.

text.text: How does the billing customer assignment setting affect a user's access to payers and facilities?

text: The billing customer assignment setting restricts users in a Multi-company Management environment from accessing specific child companies. If a user does not have an assigned Billing role, or a customized role in User Groups, then you can pick-and-chose any child company from the "Billing Customer assignments" list in their User Account.

text.text: What is the significance of the context switcher in the billing customer assignment setup?

text: The context switcher allows users to switch between a parent company and its child companies, as well as between child companies themselves. The parent company's name is displayed in bold at the top of the context switcher list, followed by the indented names of its children.

text.text: How does Barney's access differ from Betty's as per the billing customer assignments?

text: Barney is a Standard User with a Biller role. He has access to two child companies. Betty is a Company Administrator. She has access to all child companies.

text.text: What actions can Barney perform in the child companies he has access to?

text: Barney can perform his duties as a Biller in the child companies he has access to. He cannot create payers or facilities at the parent level and copy them down to the selected child companies.

text.text: Why does Barney not have permission to create payers or facilities at the parent level?

text: Barney does not have permission to create payers or facilities at the parent level because he does not have the permission to do so.

text.text: Can Betty manage payers and facilities across all child companies?

text: Yes, Betty can manage payers and facilities across all child companies.

text.text: What actions are restricted for users with limited billing customer assignments?

text: Users with limited billing customer assignments cannot manage payers and facilities across all child companies.

text.text: How does the billing customer assignment setting ensure data integrity and prevent duplicates?

text: The billing customer assignment setting ensures data integrity and prevents duplicates by reducing the chances of duplicates in the system.

text.text: Can a user have different billing customer assignments for different roles?

text: Yes, a user can have different billing customer assignments for different roles.

text.text: What happens if a child company is added or removed from the billing customer assignments list?

text: If a child company is selected for a role in User Groups, when that role is assigned to a user in User Accounts, that user automatically gets access to the child companies defined by that role. You can add a child company, but you cannot delete one configured for that role.

text.text: How does the billing customer assignment setting streamline user access in a multi-company setup?

text: The billing customer assignment setting streamlines user access in a multi-company setup by restricting users from accessing specific child companies.

text.text: Where can users find support or guidance regarding billing customer assignments if they encounter issues?

text: Users can find support or guidance regarding billing customer assignments by contacting.

text.text: what is Billing Customer Assignments?

text: Billing Customer Assignments is a setting in Admin > Billing > User Accounts and Admin > Billing > User Groups that restricts users in a Multi-company Management environment from accessing specific child companies.

text.text: what is An assigned role?

text: If a child company is selected for a role in User Groups, when that role is assigned to a user in User Accounts, that user automatically gets access to the child companies defined by that role. You can add a child company, but you cannot delete one configured for that role.

text.text: what are the Company Administrator account types?

text: Company Administrator account types have full access to everything within ZOLL Billing. They can manage payers and facilities (create/edit/delete/copy) at the parent company level.
